author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court Bench here has ordered an enquiry by a District Judge into the claim made by wife of Raja Hussain, a life convict in a case under Terrorist and Disruptive Activities (Prevention) Act, that he was kept in solitary confinement in Cuddalore Central Prison despite having suffered heart attack twice. A Division Bench of Justices A. Selvam and V.S. Ravi directed the District Judge to conduct an enquiry and submit a report to the court by March 15.

The order was passed after A. Kumaresan, Additonal Superintendent of Prison, filed a counter affidavit denying the allegation of having kept the petitioner’s husband in solitary confinement.
title: HC Bench orders enquiry
